meanings.sent1: The sun will illuminate the sky at dawn.
meanings.sent2: She used a flashlight to illuminate the dark room.
meanings.sent3: The fireflies illuminate the garden like tiny lanterns.
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to illuminate the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse helped illuminate the path for ships at night.

meanings.sent1: The teacher used examples to illuminate the concept.
meanings.sent2: The diagram helped illuminate the complex idea.
meanings.sent3: His explanation did not illuminate the confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her question seemed to illuminate the issue at hand.
meanings.sent5: The map will illuminate the route for easy understanding.

meanings.definition: To decorate with lights or colors
meanings.sent1: They will illuminate the Christmas tree with colorful lights.
meanings.sent2: The city streets were illuminated with festive decorations.
meanings.sent3: The party planner will illuminate the venue with bright colors.
meanings.sent4: The stage was illuminated with dazzling lights for the performance.
meanings.sent5: The artist will illuminate the artwork with vibrant hues.
